title: Weather advice emojis and actionable guidance

requirements.summary: Enhance generated weather advice to include clear, actionable guidance and relevant emojis for rainy, cold, and hot conditions.
acceptanceCriteria: When the app detects rainy/drizzly conditions, the advice includes an umbrella-related message and contains at least one umbrella/rain emoji in the displayed title and/or message.

When the app detects cold conditions, the advice includes an explicit “wear warm clothes/dress warmly” style message and contains at least one cold/warm-clothes emoji in the displayed title and/or message.
When the app detects hot conditions, the advice includes an explicit “stay hydrated” style message and contains at least one heat/hydration emoji in the displayed title and/or message.
Advice with emojis is visible in the existing AdviceBanner UI (no emojis-only; keep readable English text).

file_operations.description: Update the advice generation logic to embed readable English action messages (e.g., carry an umbrella, dress warmly, stay hydrated) and include appropriate emojis in the returned WeatherAdvice title/message strings for rainy/drizzly, cold, and hot conditions.

requirements.summary: Prevent layout regressions in AdviceBanner so emoji-inclusive titles/messages remain readable and wrap cleanly on mobile in light/dark mode.
acceptanceCriteria: AdviceBanner shows emoji characters correctly (not replaced by missing glyph boxes) in modern browsers.
Longer advice messages that include emojis wrap cleanly and remain fully readable on mobile widths.

file_operations.description: Adjust AdviceBanner layout/typography classes to ensure long title/message text (including emojis) wraps cleanly without truncation; add flex/min-width and word-breaking safeguards while continuing to render the provided advice.title and advice.message strings. This component uses shadcn-ui Alert building blocks—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Harden global font fallback to include common color-emoji fonts so emoji glyphs render reliably across platforms in both light and dark mode.
